intro: Fleischmannia chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky environments and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
